definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.english: Opinions on bombing the Serbs cut across party lines.
sentences.chinese: 关于轰炸塞尔维亚的意见违反了党的路线。

sentences.english: The attack breached their cease-fire agreement.
sentences.chinese: 他们的进攻行动违反了停火协定。

sentences.english: (against) Using a cell phone while driving is against the traffic rules.
sentences.chinese: 边开车边打手机是违反交通规则的。

sentences.english: No! Here, the design violates the LSP.
sentences.chinese: 不能，这个设计就违反了LSP。

sentences.english: F. Other the promotion behavior of all lawbreaking code.
sentences.chinese: 其他一切违反法律法规的推广行为。

sentences.english: And you are saying wait a minute, he has violated the Pauli Exclusion Principle.
sentences.chinese: 你们有人在喊我停一下，说我违反了保利不相容原理。

sentences.english: PR8 Total number of substantiated complaints regarding breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data.
sentences.chinese: PR8违反客户隐私及遗失客户资料的申诉案总数。

sentences.english: The competent authorities shall impose necessary administrative and disciplinary sanctions on those who have violated the aforesaid provisions.
sentences.chinese: 违反者，主管部门应给予必要的行政或纪律处分。

sentences.english: I kind of broke the rules when I photocopied your file.
sentences.chinese: 我影印妳的档案多少是违反规定的。

sentences.english: All acts in violation of the Constitution or the law must be investigated.
sentences.chinese: 一切违反宪法和法律的行为，必须予以追究。

sentences.english: To a first approximation, the non-economist's answers violate fundamental economic logic.
sentences.chinese: 大致上，非经济学家的答案违反了基本的经济逻辑。

sentences.english: In doing so, the US has violated international law and encroached upon China's sovereignty and territorial airspace.
sentences.chinese: 美机此举违反了国际法，侵犯了中国主权和领空。

sentences.english: These methods might be violating SRP, right?
sentences.chinese: 这种方法就违反了SRP啊，对不对？

sentences.english: If the task publishers had breached the entries listed tasks will probably face legal sanctions.
sentences.chinese: 若发布任务者违反词条列，将可能面对法律的制裁。

sentences.english: We couldn't keep them here against their will.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能违反他们的意愿，强留他们在这里。

definition: provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
to comply with/to abide by/to respect (an agreement)
